instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3330: What is 820-3330? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B
threads.message:
looking some help, this board wont turn on with track pad connected, without track pad working fine. tried good track pad and flex same.
where should i start troubleshooting?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B
threads.message:
First of all, welcome to the forum!

Check diode mode to ground on pins 21/22 of J5800, with trackpad connected.
Find some components connected to the same lines, not directly on the connector pins.
Do not apply power to the board, of course...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B
threads.message:
I'm not sure if I correctly understood you.
Do you mean it turns on with trackpad connected, but <RESISTOR>R5805</RESISTOR> removed?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B
threads.message: yest track pad connected but <RESISTOR>R5805</RESISTOR> removed

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B
threads.message:
Chcek <DIODE>D5802</DIODE>.
If good, change <CHIP>U5805</CHIP>.
If still bad, change L5801.

Resolder <RESISTOR>R5805</RESISTOR> first...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B
threads.message: thank you i will try that tomorrow and update you...
